intro: Psychotria zombamontana, commonly known as the zombie plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It contains alkaloids, including psychotrimine, which have psychoactive properties. Due to its unique appearance and chemical composition, it has attracted interest in both botanical and ethnobotanical studies.
